title: Possibly a controversial opinion
body: But I wholeheartedly believe that Courage of the Colossus was a much more healthy Keystone than Aftershock is. All it did was give survivability through a shield that increased by number of enemy champions around. Something that was also much easier to balance. Aftershock gives damage, armor, and magic resist. It's too much. I love tanks and Maokai was my first main champion ever but Aftershock is gross and needs to go. Give tanks a true Keystone that doesn't also give damage. I miss Courage of the Colossus and furthermore, I miss Strength of the Ages.

replies.body:
I actually miss Courage a lot but at the same time, I feel like they're worried about adding it again because they have Guardian but the problem with that logic is that no one takes Guardian. In theory, Guardian is a great idea for support tanks... but in practice, Aftershock is just so overwhelmingly *broken* that you can't make an argument for taking Guardian over it as *anyone.* And that's another thing. A lot of big abusers of it aren't even tanks that it should be. Quinn, Lissandra, Ryze, etc. People who aren't intended to be tanky are using it to be tanky. 

I wish they'd bring back Font of Life and Courage of the Colossus. Font of Life had niche uses for supports like Braum and pre-reworked Nunu and Colossus was really nice.
Lissandra and Ryze are actually supposed to be pretty bulky, at least for Mages.

they shouldn't get the full benefit of using what is supposed to be a tank Keystone without building TANK. Currently they're getting 70-120 armor/magic resist while also building full damage. that's bullshit. what they gain in survivability by taking Aftershock completely makes up for what damage they are missing by not taking Electricute or Phase Rush and then some.

Except they're not building full damage. Ryze and Lissandra tend to opt for the bulkier and lower damage (or at least slow scaling {{item:3027}} {{item:3003}} ) AP items. Ryze in particular has always had a history of sometimes opting into straight Tank items, and I imagine Liss would be the same if I knew more about her.

And your last sentence sets up a pretty good premise for why they should be allowed to use the rune. They're giving up damage for survivability, isn't that good tactical decision making that we should be celebrating?

The other gives mana and AP....and I haven't seen a Lissandra build either of those items in a very long time. Since like Season 7.

Notice the word "or".

According to lolalytics, Ryze is 37th place out of 59 Mid Laners in terms of total damage. Lissandra is 44th place. They're not outputting the damage you seem to be hyperbole-ing for.

I think Aftershock should be changed to something like:

Small base armor/MR (like 1/5 what it is now)+large % of bonus armor mr (maybe even 100%). Greatly reduce current base damage+remove the AD scaling, and add a small shield based on bonus HP.

Now the only way to effectively use it would be to build pure tank-armor/mr+HP. Since it scales entirely off of defense, a tank would become EXTREMELY difficult to kill-loads of armor/mr+shield.

As for Guardian,  maybe add some extra passives on it that give bonuses to activatible  items, and/or benefits good for allies-additional life steal/atk spd/ap for them when they get shielded. I don't know, not too sure on this. Alternatively, perhaps allow you to take a small part of their damage for them. Maybe a slowly regenerating shield? Greatly enhanced hp regen for a short time whenever you take a skill shot? Shooting out ideas...

Game has been on a downward spiral for a while now, high dps runes, keep on nerfing jungle exp and gold then get upset that junglers are ganking more so to fix it they will nerf exp and gold again.

Return old dark harvest and lower all rune damage by 5-15 points across the board, additionally remove rune quests that encourage random aggression for no reason just so you can "stack it" remove jungle plant vision and restore proper jungle vision options, add back the non combat smite buffs like raptors and wolf.

lower camp respawn time in such a way that missing out on camp farm clearing can actually cost you resources thus encouraging junglers who actually visit the jungle.

What you're not realizing is that Riot is moving away from shields because they are incredibly annoying. Throwing all of your abilities onto someone just for them to take 0 damage because a shield ate it is terrible.

For starters, there would be a cooldown so that CoC could only proc once per fight, and tanks SHOULD be rewarded for playing their role and frontline facetanking damage to allow their own damage dealers to DPS in relative safety. I have absolutely no problem with granting a shield that scales with how many enemy champions are within a certain range, bonus health, bonus armor/magic resist, etc. Stop trying to give tanks Keystones that have damage attached for no fucking reason. Tanks are SUPPOSED to soak damage, be immobile, and have high base damages with shit scaling, and CC. And for champions like Nautilus, place a mechanic that puts CoC on a CD while a shield is active or give it like 50% of it's normal shield.
How is it a controversial opinion?

Personally, I agree that the shield was a better effect for tanks than the current bonus resistances. The reason is that tank items oftentimes already feature resistances, making additional health (or pseudo-health in form of shields) much more valuable than additional resistances.

I'd absolutely love it if they took Courage of the Colossus's mechanics and added the damage component of current Aftershock for an Aftershock rework.

Courage of the Colossus was pretty great on that front. I miss that big, beautiful shield that got strong with more enemies around.

Wall of text following though.

There’s two big issues I see though that makes Aftershock an issue. The first is the damage. The second is the sheer amount of flat resists it gives. This is what makes it even better on non-tanks. Patch 8.2 is where it broke.

> Removed: Armor ratio of 30% armor.
> Bonus armor increased to 70 − 120 (based on level) from 20 at all levels.
> Removed: Magic resistance ratio of 30% magic resistance.
> Bonus magic resistance increased to 70 − 120 (based on level) from 20 at all levels.
> Shockwave base damage reduced to 10 − 120 (based on level) from 40 − 140 (based on level).
> Shockwave health ratio reduced to 3% of maximum health from 3.5%.
> New Effect: Shockwave damage now scales with 15% bonus AD.
> New Effect: Shockwave damage now scales with 10% AP.

That was all one patch. They made the damage scale with more stats, removed the scaling resists and gave it much higher flat stats. If they revert it to the less damage, lower base stat grant and give it the bonus armor/mr ratios, it’d be much better for tanks. **Currently, at level 1 it gives more resists than almost every tank item.** For armor, the only items that give more armor than *it’s level 1 value* are {{item:3373}} {{item:3110}} {{item:3387}} {{item:3075}}, two of which are only available of Ornn is in the match. For MR, the only two items available on Summoner’s Rift that surpass Aftershock’s level 1 value are {{item:3379}} {{item:3383}}, again, only available with Ornn. That’s insane flat value just for one CC.

The problem is, they *wanted* non tanks to start using it and having fun with it. Honestly, their reasoning on this one..just doesn’t make sense: 

> Aftershock's base damage is a bit too high, and it's letting champions like Alistar or Leona run wild in early duels against marksmen. Having one mastery be so good for both durability and damage is warping interactions between tanks and squishier champions, so we're shifting the item profile to be less about damage and more about durability. While we're at it, we're shifting the resistances gain from percent to flat so that divers can get in on the fun, too.

I honestly don’t understand. You took a rune that tanks would prefer, and made it a Diver preferred rune. If it’s to stay instead of Courage of the Colossus, Give it back the bonus resist ratios, reduce the flat amount. They honestly broke it when they made that change.
